info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 18 at 9:48AM CST until January 18 at 10:30AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM CST FOR NORTHWESTERN CADDO AND NORTHWESTERN BOSSIER PARISHES... At 947 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Oil City, or 20 miles northwest of Shreveport, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Vivian, Plain Dealing, Oil City, Mooringsport, Hosston, Belcher, Ida, Gilliam, Dixie, Alden Bridge, Rocky Mount, Caddo Lake, Cavett, Bolinger and Bethany. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM CST for southwestern Arkansas...and northwestern Louisiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
